metadata.title: CVE-2023-52614 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: PM /devfreq: Fix buffer overflow in trans_stat_show Fix buffer overflow intrans_stat_show(). Convert simple snprintf to the more secure scnprintfwith size of PAGE_SIZE. Add condition checking if we are exceedingPAGE_SIZE and exit early from loop. Also add at the end a warning that weexceeded PAGE_SIZE and that stats is disabled. Return -EFBIG in the casewhere we don't have enough space to write the full transition table. Alsodocument in the ABI that this function can return -EFBIG error.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52614` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-aws - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency - 6.8.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-oracle - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1001-raspi - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1005.12
No subscription required
